[[Mainframe computer|Mainframe Migration]] | revenue = {{profit}} $90 million [[United States dollar|USD]] (2011) | homepage = [http://www.globant.com/ www.globant.com] }} '''Globant''' is an [[Information technology|IT]] and [[Software Development]] company operating in [[Argentina]], [[Colombia]], [[Uruguay]], [[England]], [[Brazil]] and the [[United States]]. It was formed in 2003 by Martín Migoya, Guibert Englebienne, Martín Umaran and Néstor Nocetti.{{cite web|url=http://www.globant.com/corp/company/content/620/our-history|title=Globant´s History|coauthors=Several|date=January 2006|accessdate=2008-11-21}} It is headquartered in [[Buenos Aires]]. == Timeline == * 2003: Globant started operations with own funded capital. * 2005: Globant opened its second Development Center in [[Buenos Aires]]. The company was also named [[Endeavor (non-profit)|Endeavor]] Entrepreneur 2005{{cite web|url=http://www.endeavor.org.ar/emp_argentina.html|title=Endeavor Argentina|coauthors=Several|date=January 2008 |publisher= Endeavor |language=Spanish|accessdate=2008-11-19}} was recognized as the Best Services Exporter by Export. Ar.{{Citation needed|date=November 2008}} The [[MIT Sloan School of Management|Sloan School of Management]] of the [[MIT]] wrote a case about Globant called: "Leading the IT Revolution in Latin America".{{cite web|url=http://scripts.mit.edu/~rlocke/docs/Courses/Sloan/15.389A_G-Lab_LA_Syllabus_2008-09_web.pdf|title=Globant at the MIT|coauthors=Several|date=January 2008 |publisher=G-Lab, Sloan School of Management MIT|accessdate=2008-11-19}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010 |bot=H3llBot}}{{cite web|url=http://66.102.1.132/translate_c?hl=es&ie=UTF-8&sl=es&tl=en&u=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/nota.asp%3Fnota_id%3D785973&usg=ALkJrhi4MCtvcz3klsL0ZIg9rDvqdDmRGw |title=Consulting with Support of the MIT|coauthors=Several|date=March 2006 |publisher=La Nación |accessdate= 2008-11-19}} * 2006: Globant opened its development center in the city of Tandil, Argentina. * 2007: Globant certified [[CMMI]] level 3.{{Citation needed|date=November 2008}} The company was recognized as the Top Emerging Global Services Provider, by Global Services Magazine.{{cite web |url=http://www.globalservicesmedia.com/Content/general20070521177.asp|title=Top 5 Emerging Services Provider --2007 Winner Globant|coauthors=Several|date=February 2007|publisher=Global Services Magazine |accessdate=2007-11-21}} Globant opened offices in the city of La Plata, Argentina; and expanded its operations also in the US (Palo Alto). Globant founded Fonalix with BGH, a company that provides [[Voice over Internet Protocol|IP Telephony Solutions]] for small and medium business in [[Latin America]]. * 2008: The research company [[International Data Corporation|IDC]] pointed Globant as one of the growing companies in Latin America in its study "Latin American Predictions 2008".{{cite web |url= http://www.idc.com/getdoc.jsp?containerId=LA18202|title=Latin America Predictions 2008 |date=January 2008|publisher=IDC|accessdate=2008-11-20}} Globant Acquires Accendra, an Argentine {{cite web|url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/nota.asp?nota_id=1023009 |title=Globant acquires Accendra|coauthors=Several|date=January 2008|publisher=La Nación |language= Spanish |accessdate= 2008-11-21}} Software Company with 100 employees adding operations in Chile and Colombia. In December, Globant closed its third financing round of USD13MM with Riverwood Capital and FTV Capital.{{cite web|url=http://www.ftvcapital.com/press/20081202.html|title=Globant Secures $13 Million Investment from FTVentures and Riverwood Capital|coauthors=Several|date=December 2009 |accessdate= 2009-01-21}} It also acquired [[Openware]], an Argentine {{cite web |url= http://www.bnamericas.com/news/technology/Globant_gets_Openware_for_US*1,5mn|title=Globant Gets Openware for USD1.5MM|coauthors=Several|date=December 2008|publisher=Business News America |accessdate= 2008-12-21}} company specialized in Security & Infrastructure Management. Globant's team of [[Glober]]s reached the 1000 professionals * 2009: Globant received two teams from the Global Entrepreneurship lab from the [[MIT]], to study the M&A strategy and the Globant University Project. * 2010: Globant was awarded with the AlwaysON 250 award for creating technology innovations for the Global Silicon Valley, in the Cloud and Infrastructure Category.{{cite news | title = Announcing the 2010 AlwaysOn Global 250 | publisher = AlwaysON | date = 2010-07-31 | url = http://alwayson.goingon.com/AOStory/Announcing-2010-AlwaysOn-Global-250 | accessdate = 2010-02-25}} It was also named Cool Vendor by Gartner, in the Cool Vendors in Business Process Services 2010 report by Gartner, Inc.{{cite news | title = Cool Vendor in Business Process Services, 2010 | publisher = Gartner | date = 2010-03-31 | url = http://www.gartner.com/DisplayDocument?doc_cd=174972 | accessdate = 2010-02-25}} During this year, Globant also reorganized itself and launched 8 studios, each one specializing in a different vertical, practice or industry. They are: [http://www.globant.com/studio/203/gaming Gaming Studio], [http://www.globant.com/studio/201/big-data-high-performance-solutions Big Data & High Performance Studio], [http://www.globant.com/studio/206/consumer-experience Consumer Experience Studio], [http://www.globant.com/studio/545/enterprise-consumerization Enterprise Consumerization Studio], [http://www.globant.com/studio/200/mobile Mobile] and [http://www.globant.com/studio/202/quality-engineering Quality Engineering Studio]. * 2011: Globant acquired San Francisco-based
